unlikely to see that scenario. If it does occur, consider trading individual stocks with high IVR instead of indexes. High VIX above 30 typically corresponds to high IVR, so focus on stocks with elevated IVR levels for potential trading opportunities.

If the IV Rank is above 30 and the IV Rank is below 20, it is a rare occurrence. Stick to the rules and mechanics of trading - if the IV Rank is low, avoid the trade. If the IV Rank is high, consider getting into the trade.
It is rare to encounter a situation where you can enter a trade. It may happen once in a blue moon.
